model.musicPlayer

Class MusicFolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.musicPlayer.MusicFolder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MusicFolder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      This is the folder that will be represented by this class

      This is the name of the folder being represented

      This is the next folder in the folders linked list

      This is the number of MP3 files that are contained in this folder

      This is the previous folder in the folders linked list

      This is the song that charges all the other songs in the binary search tree
      private java.util.ArrayList<Song> songs
      This is where all the songs in the binary search tree will be contained to perform the sorting algorithms
      private boolean sortedByTitle
      This indicates if the Song ArrayList is sorted by title or not.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MusicFolder

        public MusicFolder(java.io.File folder)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   FolderWithoutMP3ContentException
        The method allows to get an instance of MusicFolder that will represent the folder received as parameter.
        Parameters:
        folder - The folder to be represented by this MusicFolder
        folder is different to null and is a valid directory in this device
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the folder doesn't exist or there was another problem reading it.
        FolderWithoutMP3ContentException - if the folder doesn't contain any MP3 files in it.

    • Method Detail

      • addSongToBST

        private void addSongToBST(Song current,
                          Song addme)
        The method allows to add a new Song to the binary search tree according to the natural order.
        Parameters:
        current - The current node in the binary search tree that is responsible to add the requested node before or after itself depending on the natural order
        current != null
        addme - The node that is going to be added to the binary search tree.

      • inorder

        public java.util.ArrayList<Song> inorder()
        The method allows to obtain a list with the songs in the binary search tree in order.
        Returns:
        A Song ArrayList with the songs in order.

      • inorder

        private void inorder(Song current,
                     java.util.ArrayList<Song> tofill)
        The method allows to fill an ArrayList with the songs in the binary search tree in order.
        Parameters:
        current - The current node in the binary search tree that is going to be added to the ArrayList after its left subtree and before its right subtree
        current != null
        tofill - the ArrayList where the songs are going to accumulate.

      • preorder

        public java.util.ArrayList<Song> preorder()
        This method allows to obtain a Song ArrayList that is sorted in preorder.
        Returns:
        A Song ArrayList that is sorted in preorder.

      • preorder

        private void preorder(Song current,
                      java.util.ArrayList<Song> tofill)
        This method allows to fill a Song ArrayList with songs in preorder.
        Parameters:
        current - A Song that represents the current song to be added in the Song ArrayList
        current != null
        tofill - A Song ArrayList that represents the array where songs in preorder are going to be added.

        public boolean equals(MusicFolder another)
        The method allows to know whether this MusicFolder is equal to another one.
        Parameters:
        another - The music folder to make the comparison.
        Returns:
        A boolean that represents whether this MusicFolder equals to another

      • sortSongsByTitle

        public void sortSongsByTitle()
        The method allows to sort the songs in the playList according to its title.
        It uses bubble sort.

      • sortSongsByArtist

        public void sortSongsByArtist()
        The method allows to sort the songs in the playList according to its artist.
        It uses bubble sort.

      • sortSongsByAlbum

        public void sortSongsByAlbum()
        The method allows to sort the songs in the playList according to its album.
        It uses insertion sort.

      • sortSongsBySize

        public void sortSongsBySize()
        The method allows to sort the songs in the playList according to its size.
        It uses selection sort.

      • sortSongsByGenre

        public void sortSongsByGenre()
        The method allows to sort the songs in the playList according to its genre.
        It uses insertion sort.

      • getSongs

        public java.util.ArrayList<Song> getSongs()
        The method allows to obtain a Song ArrayList that represents all the songs inside the music folder.
        Returns:
        A Song ArrayList that represents all the songs inside the music folder.

      • search

        public Song search(java.lang.String title)
        This method allows to obtain a song specifying its title. When the list is sorted by title, it performs a binary searching in the array. Else, the searching is performed in the binary search tree.
        Parameters:
        title - A String that represents the song title from the song to find.
        title != null
        Returns:
        A Song that represents the found song when this is in the array or the three. If the method does not find the requested song it returns null

      • searchInArrayList

        private Song searchInArrayList(java.lang.String title)
        This method performs a binary searching to look for a song by title.
        Parameters:
        title - A String that represents the song title from the song to find
        title != null
        Returns:
        A Song that represents the found song when this is in the array. If the method does not find the requested song it returns null

      • searchInBinarySearchTree

        private Song searchInBinarySearchTree(Song current,
                                      java.lang.String title)
        This method performs a linear searching to look for a song by title.
        Parameters:
        current - A Song that represents the current song in the binary searching three.
        title - A String that represents the song title from the song to find
        title != null
        Returns:
        A Song that represents the found song when this is in the binary searching three. If the method does not find the requested song it returns null
